titleStmt.title: John S. Sallee et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7122

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Monticello Ky 17e Oct 1865
To his Excellency T E Bramlette Gov of Ky

your petitioners Joseph H Bond & Henry A Huffaker would State to your Excellency that during the Sprihg of the present year they were engaged in a grocery business in the Town of Monticello that they procured a government Licens from the United States assessor and was ignorant of the fact that any other Licens had to be prcoured and at the Apl Term an Indictment was found against them in the Wayne circuit court for Tipling and at the October Term they were fined $35 they are now out of any such business and ask your excellency to remit relieve them of Said fine as they were acting at the time they were retailing in good faith & did not wish intend nor desire to violate the law

Jnos S Sallee
L. J. Stephenson
F M Sumpter
H Huffaker
H W Tuttle
Flemming Bates
B, F, Flemming
Thos. A. Bates
Richard Burnett
James A Phillips.
C, A, Cox
Jas Berry
William L. Warden
William. T. Burk

Wayne Cir Ct
vs
Jos H Bond
$35
Tipling
23 Oct /65
